TopicTitle: Air Voyager: The Fuel Efficient Rocket

Articles.Content:
I just came around to introduce a fuel efficient rocket that uses jet engines until the stopping point (17-20k )....

The Air Voyager!

It is a rocket that has a .50 to .98 Fuel Efficiency and can get you to where you need to go. It can have moon modifications added if they are kept to a minimum of 5 tons.

If you wish to have a moon module added, please ask and I will get to it as fast as I can.

The craft file will be added shortly

Here's a photo album of the Air Voyager.

http://imgur.com/a/xUOPb

Edited August 11, 2012 by Navy4422
Merged picture post into the original and deleted the repeated post

Hi TheKerb321, you might want to add some pictures of your vessel, I recommend you upload them to Imgur, then post the links here in [image] tags, also you can upload your .craft file to Mediafire, that way you won't have to worry about the very small amount of file space we have here at the KSP forums
Thanks, still new here so I appreciate the support

You won't be able to edit your original post till after your 5th post unfortunately, so if you like, I'll add the links (when you provide them) to your original post to make it easier for other members to find them.

Edited August 11, 2012 by sal_vager
